N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 333.6 - Requirement for approval of administrative surcharge

State Regulations
(a) The administrative surcharge or the
component of the selling price required to perform the responsibilities as the
nonprofitmaking charitable agency or commission designated to facilitate the
distribution of orders must be clearly identified as a separate cost component
on each proposal submitted to the Office of General Services for review and
approval. This charge does not have to be a fixed charge, but may vary
according to the nature and cost of the service. (b) The Office of General Services reserves
the right to require the blind and other severely handicapped organizations
(workshops) and their nonprofit agency representatives to each maintain
accounting records and other evidence pertaining to costs incurred on the
program, and to make these records available to the State at all reasonable
times during the contract period and for three full years from the date of the
final payment. Notes
